articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Holders are calling Friendsies a “rug pull” after failing to deliver on promises—but some hope to pick up where FriendsWithYou left off.
articles.title: Friendsies 'Rug Pull' NFT Holders—Could the Community Take Over?

articles.author: Alys Key
articles.description: As AI excitement grows, a stream of malicious cryptocurrencies leveraging brand names has appeared on the market.
articles.title: Fake Bing ChatGPT Tokens Pop Up Amid AI Hype

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The premise is simple: The transaction is the wallet, meaning anyone can use it. Now, TipLink is expanding the idea with fresh funding.
articles.title: Multicoin, Sequoia Lead $6M Round in Solana-based Crypto Wallet TipLink

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Reignmakers PGA Tour will launch in March, letting users battle for millions of dollars in prize money via Polygon NFT player cards.
articles.title: DraftKings Tees Up PGA Tour NFT Fantasy Golf Game

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: As part of a larger consolidation first announced on January 11, Polygon Labs today announced it would be laying off 100 employees.
articles.title: MATIC Drops 6% as Polygon Labs Slashes Headcount by 20%

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Andrew Campbell has joined Crypto Unicorns developer Laguna Games to help expand its "multiverse" as Product and Market Growth Lead.
articles.title: Polygon’s Crypto Unicorns Game Adds Former Axie Infinity Esports Head

articles.author: Matt Hussey,Scott Chipolina
articles.description: Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies that claim to be backed by fiat currencies. Unlike cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, their prices remain steady.
articles.title: What Are Stablecoins and How Do You Use Them?

articles.author: Alys Key
articles.description: HIVE Blockchain increased its Bitcoin mining production amid an ongoing crypto winter, boasting an increase of 13% year-over-year.
articles.title: HIVE Increases Bitcoin Production in First Full Quarter Without Ethereum Mining

articles.description: With Bitcoin-based NFTs attracting the market’s attention, Stacks appears to be enjoying the spotlight with a steady rise in activity.
articles.title: Stacks Token Soars 130% on the Week Amid Bitcoin NFT Hype

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The race to bring NFTs to more proof-of-work blockchains is on, as Ordinals inscriptions were introduced to Litecoin.
articles.title: Coder Brings Ordinals to Litecoin as Bitcoin Inscriptions Surpass 154K

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Over $500 million worth of Ethereum NFT trades took place over the past week as Blur’s rewards model catapults it over OpenSea.
articles.title: Blur Overtakes OpenSea as Ethereum NFT Trading Skyrockets

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Some Moonbirds holders aren’t accepting Proof CEO Kevin Rose’s apologies as they unstake their NFTs following news of the canceled event.
articles.title: Proof Collective Cancels Conference, Ruffling Moonbirds NFT Holders

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: A report from the Bank for International Settlements claims "sophisticated" Bitcoin investors have made money but most retail buyers have lost out.
articles.title: If You Bought Bitcoin After 2015, You've Likely Lost Money: BIS

articles.description: Customers of FTX Japan will be able to withdraw cryptocurrencies and fiat currency deposited with the company.
articles.title: FTX Japan Users Can Resume Withdrawing Funds Tomorrow

articles.description: Bitcoin wallets holding over 1,000 BTC peaked in February 2021. Now, though, whale pods are dwindling fast.
articles.title: Number of Bitcoin Whales Drops to Lowest Level Since 2019

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: The inventor of the World Wide Internet Tim Berners-Lee has called crypto "dangerous" due to its highly speculative nature.
articles.title: Crypto's Speculative Nature Makes It 'Really Dangerous': Tim Berners-Lee

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: A new consultation paper from Hong Kong's financial regulator outlined several new criteria for letting retail investors back into crypto.
articles.title: Hong Kong Mulls Reopening Crypto Trading for Retail Investors

articles.author: Daniel Phillips,Scott Chipolina
articles.description: Bitcoin doesn't need to be backed by anything tangible to be valuable; like fiat currencies, much of its value derives from consumer confidence.
articles.title: What Backs Bitcoin?

articles.author: Ben Munster
articles.description: Stepn lets users earn crypto for exercising—giving them real returns for walking, jogging or running. But gameplay is complicated.
articles.title: What Is Stepn? The ‘Move-to-Earn’ NFT App That Pays You Crypto to Exercise

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: There’s another high-profile victim of the FTX meltdown as crypto hedge fund Galois Capital moved to close its business.
articles.title: Galois Capital to Shutter Flagship Crypto Fund Citing 'FTX Disaster'

articles.author: Sujith Somraaj
articles.description: The upcoming Helium migration and substantial NFT sales volume appear to be fueling a double-digit recovery for Solana.
articles.title: Solana Soars Double-Digits as Helium Network Announces Merge Date

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Jaime Rogozinski, who founded the now-iconic subreddit for financial degens, wants a court to reinstate him.
articles.title: Founder of WallStreetBets on Reddit Sues Reddit

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: Neal Mohan has said that NFTs could enable “creators to build deeper relationships with their fans.”
articles.title: New YouTube CEO Is Bullish on Web3 Tech Like NFTs and the Metaverse

articles.description: Like its New York-based counterpart, the office is looking for a CBDC developer.
articles.title: San Francisco Fed Hiring for Digital Currency Development

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: And an angry artist accused Bored Ape Yacht Club creators Yuga Labs of plagiarizing their iconic skull logo.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SEC Crypto Crackdown Met with Colossal Criticism

articles.description: Despite a market cap of over $115 million, Yuga Labs appears to have taken an unlicensed design for its Bored Ape Kennel Club logo.
articles.title: Yuga Labs to Replace Logo That Apes a Kids Drawing Guide

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: The rise of Bitcoin NFTs has sparked new outrage within the maximalist community. But for Casa’s CTO it’s time to grow up and move on.
articles.title: 'NFT Art Is Fairly Silly’ Says Casa CTO Jameson Lopp on Bitcoin Ordinals Rise

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: A new lending platform spun up by protocol engineers at MakerDAO is looking to get the decentralized stablecoin DAI into more hands.
articles.title: DAI Finds Its Spark With Spark Lend

articles.description: The former YouTube Gaming head joins Decrypt’s gm podcast to reflect on his path into crypto and how it can all go mainstream.
articles.title: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt: 'The Next Jeff Bezos Will Come From Web3'

articles.description: Crypto also caused a lot of consternation among regulators in Washington this week.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Recover Modestly as Polygon, Filecoin, OKB See Blistering Gains

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: A trader whose wallet had already been associated with front-running token listings on Binance made over $100,000 in profit on Friday.
articles.title: Trader Makes $100K in Seconds Front-Running Token Listing on Binance

articles.description: The SEC has filed fraud charges against Terra and its founder Do Kwon. Here are some of the more damning claims.
articles.title: A Stable Con: Key Takeaways From the SEC’s Lawsuit Against Terra

articles.description: A low-volume token trading on crypto exchange Huobi called "FTX Users’ Debt" is causing confusion among users.

articles.description: The NFT marketplace will only mandate an 0.5% royalty fee for projects without on-chain enforcement, but allow sellers to pay more.
articles.title: OpenSea Drops Fees, Cuts Creator Royalty Protections as Rival Blur Rises

articles.description: The crypto exchange and wallet provider had major exposure to Three Arrows Capital and conducted more layoffs last month.
articles.title: Blockchain.com Shopping Assets to Fill $270M Hole From Three Arrows Capital: Sources

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: "Blockchain has no borders,” Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao tweeted in response to reports today.
articles.title: CZ Denies Binance Is Considering Delisting Tokens From US Projects

articles.description: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry’s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon’s Winning Streak

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The ex-Boston Celtics star is the latest figure to be targeted by the increasingly tough-on-crypto SEC.
articles.title: NBA Star Paul Pierce Hit With $1.4 Million SEC Fine For Shilling Ethereum Max

articles.author: Andrew Throuvalas
articles.description: The popular move-to-earn crypto app STEPN is rolling out another airdrop. But who’s eligible?
articles.title: Who's Eligible for Stepn's Latest Token Airdrop?

articles.description: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!
articles.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: A Valentine’s airdrop from upstart NFT market Blur has sent gas prices soaring and the Ethereum blockchain burning.
articles.title: Blur's Token Airdrop Fuels Sky-High Gas Prices and Mass Ethereum Burn

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The Bitcoin community has gone wild over Ordinal Inscriptions, but what is the new thing taking over Crypto Twitter?
articles.title: What Are Ordinals? A Beginner's Guide to Bitcoin NFTs

articles.description: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."
articles.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations

articles.description: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.
articles.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3

articles.description: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn’t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping

articles.description: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.
articles.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event

articles.description: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington

articles.description: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz

articles.description: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.
articles.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi

articles.description: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.
articles.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club

articles.description: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.
articles.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3

articles.description: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.
articles.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics

articles.description: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.
articles.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'

articles.description: Meet Mr. NFT: @Farokh, who preaches daily to hundreds of thousands of NFT faithful, and is trying to building Rug Radio into a fully formed Web3 media company. Dan Roberts and Kate Irwin from the gm podcast talk to Farokh about Rug DAO and all things NFT culture. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Farokh and the Rug Radio Roadmap
